alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 12:05PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MDT /5 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in Colorado, Kit Carson and Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne and Sherman. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy. * WHEN...From 4 PM MDT /5 PM CDT/ this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of strong storms will move through portions of the Tri-State area later this afternoon into tonight. Locally heavy rainfall is expected to occur an impact many locales that have already seen soaking rains. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are at least possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
